intro: Koanophyllon andersonii, commonly known as the Anderson's koan, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It has narrow, gray-green leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
